name: Jarl Balgruuf the Greater

aspects.high_concept: The Jarl Who Refused to Choose - Until He Had To
aspects.trouble: Every Decision Costs Him Something He Cannot Afford to Lose
other_aspects: The Hold Was My Father's Before Mine

stunts: Jarl's Word: Once per session, Balgruuf's decree creates a situational aspect with 2 free invokes for the party (in Whiterun Hold only).
Soldier's Instinct: +2 to Notice in combat; never surprised in his own hold.
The Buck Stops Here: +2 to Will when resisting pressure to abandon Whiterun or its people.

personality_notes.speaking_style: Direct and pragmatic. Does not mince words. Shows genuine warmth to those who earn it. Formal in court, blunt in private.
motivations: Protect his people above all factional politics
Eventually pick the right side - not just the safer side
fears: Making the wrong choice and watching Whiterun burn for it
His sons growing up in a war-torn Skyrim
Irileth dying because of his hesitation
History judging him as a coward
quirks: Stands when others would sit during tense conversations
Checks on his sons when stressed
Defers to Irileth on tactical matters instinctively
Respects people who challenge him honestly more than those who flatter him

relationships.Irileth: Housecarl and closest advisor; trusts her judgment completely
relationships.Farengar Secret-Fire: Court wizard; appreciates his work even if he's eccentric
relationships.Ulfric Stormcloak: Respects as a warrior; resents the impossible choice he's forced
relationships.General Tullius: Recognizes the necessity; doesn't fully trust Imperial motives
relationships.The Player: Judges by deeds; rewards competence with unusual openness

trust_clock.description: Balgruuf respects those who demonstrate competence and genuine care for Whiterun's people over political allegiance.
advancement_triggers: Help defend or protect Whiterun's people (+1)
Complete a task for Farengar or the Hold (+1)
Demonstrate personal valor in his presence (+1)
Give him a principled reason to trust your judgment (+1)
Survive the Battle of Whiterun and acknowledge the cost (+2)
setback_triggers: Make him look weak in front of his court (-2)
Betray a confidence he granted you (-2)

combat_tactics: Balgruuf fights when cornered; prefers command. In his throne room he uses Irileth as a screen. If forced into direct combat, he's a capable axe-fighter who relies on his guards' discipline.
scene_triggers: Battle of Whiterun pre-battle briefing (Imperial side)
Any Hold-level political decision in Whiterun
dialogue_examples: I'm a Nord. I love Skyrim as much as any man. But I love my people more than any cause.
You want to know what it's like to sit this throne? It means every choice you make is wrong somehow.
Irileth is worth ten of any soldier either side can throw at me. Remember that.
The Stormcloaks, the Empire... they both talk about Skyrim. Neither of them talks about Whiterun.
gm_notes: Balgruuf is the moral center of the civil war's human cost. He doesn't want to choose sides - not because he's weak but because he understands what choosing means. Let PCs build genuine trust with him; it makes the stakes of the battle more meaningful. His relationship with Irileth should be portrayed as deep mutual respect. If Balgruuf is killed, treat it as a major canon fracture requiring a Dragonbreak check.

battle_of_whiterun_role.imperial: Active participant in the defense; coordinates from Dragonsreach; grants party Jarl's authority boon if trust is high
battle_of_whiterun_role.stormcloak: Target/defender; can surrender, fight, or accept honorable exile (requires Ulfric's Trust + high Rapport)
